channel.title: Unban logs
channel.description: How can I create unban logs? This is pretty urgent right now, as I need to know which of my staff members has a mod account he's abusing.

item.title: Unban logs
item.dc:creator: @MoparScaperDude MoparScaperDude
item.description:
@MoparScaperDude wrote:

What? I want to make logs on which staff member has unbanned who.

Read full topic

item.title: Unban logs
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

Here you go.
Go into your data folder and make a new txt document.
Name it unbannedusers with NO capitals.

Not replace your unban code with this.

[code] } else if (command.startsWith(“unban”) && playerRights >= 3) { // made by Musicmad
File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt");

        if (file.exists()) {
            String victim = command.substring(5);

            sendMessage("Player " + victim + " successfully unbanned"); // made by Musicmad	
            try {
                BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
                BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
                String unban = command.substring(6);
                String inFile;

                while ((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) {
                    if (inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unban)) {// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file.
                    } else {
                        out.write(inFile); // made by Musicmad
                    }

                }
            } catch (IOException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        } else {
            System.out.println("Error unbanning user"); 	
        }
    }[/code]

Or modify your original code with this.

File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt");

Thanks for asking a question, as it makes the forums more reliable than people afraid to ask.
Your forum friend
~.Tony.~

Read full topic
